data.title: Best TV Shows with Black Actors Airing and Streaming Now
data.meta_description: From family and comedy to drama, explore all types of TV shows with Black actors to keep you culturally engaged & entertained.
data.text:
Best TV shows with Black actors in 2024 that provide suspense, thriller, drama, and comedy before bedtime.

Below are current TV shows with Black actors in lead roles. Genres include true crime, comedy, drama, suspense, action, and more. Plus, see what new shows you can look forward to.

Did you miss the episode when it aired? Many television shows can be watched on streaming services, so binge on. Whether it’s a reboot of an old sitcom or a new dramedy, these TV shows are perfect for you!

*The information in this article is as current as the publication date.

Streaming

Black Documentaries

Sprint (TV-MA)

Netflix

Elite sprinters navigate training, media scrutiny, and fierce competition in this sports series following their race to become the world’s fastest humans. With Olympic champions and more, this documentary explores the lives of the top runners in the world. Is it only about the speed? Check it out on Netflix today!

Starring: Sha’carri Richardson

Simone Biles Rising (TV-14)

Netflix

Simone Biles took the world by storm. Known as the GOAT of gymnastics, Biles seemed to have it all. But it’s not that easy to be at the top. Biles has to balance her personal life, mental health, and training to make her triumphant return to the Olympics. Check it out on Netflix today!

Starring: Simone Biles

Received (TV-MA)

Netflix

What is it like to be a wide receiver in the NFL? This riveting sports series follows the 2023 season of NFL receivers Davante Adams, Justin Jefferson, George Kittle, Deebo Samuel, and Amon-Ra St. Brown. Explore the highs and lows of being a professional football player under constant pressure to score. Check it out on Netflix today!

Starring: Justin Jefferson

Black Action Shows

Curses (TV-G)

Apple TV+

A typical family lives an everyday life until their father is turned to stone. How will they reverse the curse? It’s up to this mother and two kids to find the ancient artifacts and return everything to normal. Check out this Black family’s wacky antics in this animated adventure. Stream Curses today!

Starring: Andre Robinson

Doctor Who (TV-PG)

Disney+

The Doctor and his companion, Ruby Sunday, travel across time and space. Throughout their adventures in the TARDIS—a time-traveling ship shaped like a police box—they encounter incredible friends and foes. Their adventures span eras, from the Regency era in England to war-torn future worlds. Check out Doctor Who on Disney+ today!

Starring: Ncuti Gatwa

Black Reality Shows

The Braxtons (TV-14) New

ALLBLK

Two years after Traci’s passing, the Braxtons reunite to fulfill her wish for the sisters to stay close. Toni, Tamar, Towanda, Trina, and Miss E navigate careers, health challenges, and personal lives, supporting each other and honoring Traci’s legacy. Check out the new adventures of the iconic family on ALLBLK on August 9.

Starring: Toni Braxton

Hart to Heart (TV-MA)

Peacock

A-list talent will join Kevin in conversations to reveal their honest, unfiltered, and unexpected true selves. It’s a place where the public will see the human side of our most well-known celebrities and world influencers. Each episode will contain meaningful conversation, open dialogue, and much heart.

Starring: Kevin Hart

Black Comedy Shows

MakeupXBreakup (TV-MA)

ALLBLK

When Brooke ends their two-year relationship, Blake doesn’t hesitate before jumping back into the New York dating scene. Even though Blake is blindsided by Brooke’s choice to end the relationship, he won’t give up on love. Check out the newest season of this romantic comedy on ALLBLK today! See if Blake can heal his heart.

Starring: Nicolette Ellis

Act Your Age (TV-14)

Netflix

Three single friends move in together, rooting for — and roasting — each other as they tackle work, love, and parenting. Is 50 too late to start over? Not if you have your best friends by your side. Watch their crazy antics and laugh as they experience real life. Check out Act Your Age on Netflix today.

Starring: Mike Epps

Mr. Throwback (TV-MA) New

Peacock

An unfortunate memorabilia salesman hopes to find forgiveness by reconciling with NBA legend Steph Curry, a teammate from his sixth-grade years. When he’s in a bind, he hopes his reunion with Curry will turn his life around. But what happens when the problem gets bigger? Find out on Peacock today!

Starring: Stephen Curry

Black Drama Shows

Òlòtūré: The Journey (TV-MA)

Netflix

Working undercover as a sex worker in Nigeria, a young journalist out to expose corruption. Òlòtūré fights for her life as she forges a path to Europe. When she is caught in a gang war, will she be able to do her job and protect those around her? Find out on Netflix today!

Starring: Sharon Ooja

Domino Day: Lone Witch (Not Rated)

Sundance Now

This supernatural drama follows Domino Day, a powerful young witch with a dark secret: she has to feed on humans’ energy to survive. She doesn’t know that a coven of witches is already tracking her every move, convinced they have to stop her. When a dangerous figure from Domino’s past comes back to haunt her, will it be a fresh start for them all or a final showdown?

Starring: Siena Kelly

Tyler Perry’s Ruthless (TV-MA) New

BET+

Ruth Truesdale unexpectedly becomes entangled in a scandalous cult of powerful sex-crazed fanatics. Buying time, she must play along until she can find a way to free herself and her young daughter. Will she be able to resist their ideologies and protect her family? Catch up on the previous seasons and prepare for the season 5 premiere!

Starring: Melissa L. Williams

Diarra from Detroit (TV-MA)

BET+

A divorcing, overworked teacher finds herself drawn into a cold case after a surprising dating app match. She suspects her match is the adult version of a boy abducted in the 90s. Will she be able to prove his identity and help him find peace? Find out more about his story and follow the cold case on BET+. Binge the entire series today.

Starring: Diarra Kilpatrick

Savage Beauty (TV-MA)

Netflix

Seeking revenge for her tragic past, a mysterious woman embeds herself in a powerful family that possesses a global beauty empire and dark secrets. From PR scandals to releasing explosive videos, this family has much to hide and more to lose. Check out Season 2 on Netflix.

Starring: Rosemary Zimu

Lady in the Lake (TV-MA)

Apple TV+

When the disappearance of a young girl grips the city of Baltimore on Thanksgiving 1966, the lives of two women converge. A bored housewife becomes captivated by the unsolved crime and takes up investigative journalism. Her investigation leads her to another mother, who is focused on the advancement of Black people in Baltimore. Check out new episodes every Friday.

Starring: Moses Ingram

Airing

Black Documentaries

Down in the Valley (TV-MA)

Starz

Down in the Valley takes viewers on a compelling tour of the Deep South, unveiling a complex, poignant, joyful, and magical South. Nicco Annan explores the sensuality, the music, and the diverse stories of the South and puts them center stage. Check out the series premiere on Starz today!

Starring: Nicco Annan

America in Black (Not Rated)

BET

This monthly newsmagazine series features interviews, celebrity profiles, and in-depth reporting on essential stories impacting and shaping Black America. Learn more about Black America with this fun docuseries. Whether it’s celebrity news or important Black issues, America in Black will catch you up. Binge both season on BET+ today!

Starring: Roy Wood Jr.

Erased: WW2’s Heroes of Color (Not Rated)

Hulu

Hear the untold stories of soldiers of color who were integral to four of the most significant battles of WW2. Through archival footage and dramatizations, Idris Elba uncovers the legacies of soldiers of color during World War II. Check out the entire docuseries on Hulu today—dive into the history of soldiers of color.

Starring: Idris Elba

Black Comedy Shows

Wayne Brady: The Family Remix (TV-14)

Freeform

With Brady at a sudden crossroads, viewers get an intimate look into his blended family’s personal life, revealing unexpected points of view and values. People see their social media posts — from vacations to dancing in TikToks — but what’s behind the joyful 15 seconds of fun? Their real life is not always as easy and as simple as it seems. Check out the series on Wednesdays at 10 p.m.

Starring: Wayne Brady

Johnson (TV-14) New

Bounce

Omar, Greg, Keith, and Jarvis met in grade school and have been best friends ever since. They all just so happened to have the same last name, Johnson —no relation. After 25 years of friendship, they find themselves in vastly different places, threatening the unity that has always been so strong. They confront and find humor in the most current controversial social issues from the Black Man’s perspective. Check out the season premiere on August 3 at 8 p.m.

Starring: Thomas Q. Jones

Reality

Wiggin’ Out With Tokyo Stylez (TV-14) New

WE TV

When Hollywood’s finest needs a hair transformation, there’s only one person to call. This series gives viewers an inside look as Tokyo meets with, curates, and installs wigs for her high-profile clientele. Each wig comes with a set of challenges, and Tokyo must balance deadlines, client demands, and finding time for her life outside of the salon.

Starring: Tokyo Stylez

Love & Marriage: Detriot (TV-14)

OWN

Three couples and longtime family friends want to show the world that Detroit is more than grit, abandoned factories, and 8 Mile Road. This reemerging city is all about family, friendship, business, excellence, and, of course, love and marriage. These couples will prove they can provide the best lives possible for their families in this community on a comeback. Check out new episodes on Saturdays at 9 p.m.

Starring: Brandon Bowman Smith

Ms. Pat Settles It (TV-14)

Ms. Pat brings her brutally honest brand of comedy to the courtroom along with a jury of family, friends, and fellow comedians. It’s up to her to preside over real-life cases and deliver just verdicts with humor and heart. From relationship drama to petty disputes, Ms. Pat is sure to deliver. Check out new episodes on Wednesdays at 9 p.m.

Starring: Ms. Pat

Black Drama Shows

Snowpiercer (TV-MA)

AMC

Seven years after the world has become a frozen wasteland, the remnants of humanity inhabit a perpetually moving train. This train circles the globe while class warfare, social injustice, and the politics of survival play out. The world may be destroyed, but humanity is still looking for things to fight over. Check out the final episodes on Sundays at 9 p.m.

Starring: Daveed Diggs

All American: Homecoming (TV-14)

The CW

A young tennis hopeful and an elite baseball player tackle college athletics while navigating the complexities of their personal lives. Set at an HBCU, the cultural triumphs and turbulence threaten their ability to focus on their sports. Will they handle the pressure? Find out with the episodes on Mondays at 9 p.m.

Starring: Gerrfri Maya

The Lazarus Project (TV-MA)

TNT

In the new season, resolute Lazarus agent George is disgraced after betraying the organization in the name of love. He is determined to redeem himself and win back the trust of his friends, colleagues, and lover. But he discovers that the cause he is fighting for is more sinister than it appears. Can George trust anyone but himself?

Starring: Paapa Essiedu

61st Street (TV-MA)

The CW

Moses Johnson, a promising athlete, gets swept up in the Chicago criminal justice system when he is arrested as a supposed gang member. Franklin Roberts, who has promised his wife that he will retire as a public defender, takes on Johnson’s case because he recognizes its potential. Roberts seeks to upend the entire Chicago judicial system, challenging the institutional racism and endemic corruption at its heart.

Starring: Courtney B. Vance

There are so many great shows on this list. Break away from Game of Thrones and Stranger Things to check out some of the Best TV Shows with Black Actors. Whether airing on Fox or streaming on AMC, these TV shows are a hit!

Did we miss your favorite Black TV Show? Please let us know what Black TV shows we missed in the comments or at The Voice of Black Cincinnati.

The Voice of Black Cincinnati is a media company designed to educate, recognize, and create opportunities for African Americans. Want to find local news, events, job postings, scholarships, and a database of local Black-owned businesses?
